intro: Weinmannia devogelii, commonly known as the Hawaiian weinmannia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Cupressaceae, which includes cypress and related conifers. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and unique, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments on forest floors. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
